meanings.definition: To stay awake longer than someone else.
meanings.sent1: I will outwatch my friend during our sleepover.
meanings.sent2: She always outwatches me when we have movie marathons.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to outwatch the dog, but eventually fell asleep.
meanings.sent4: The stars seem to outwatch us as we gaze at the night sky.
meanings.sent5: Outwatching the sunrise is a peaceful way to start the day.

meanings.definition: To keep watch over someone or something for a longer period of time.
meanings.sent1: The security guard will outwatch the building all night.
meanings.sent2: Parents often outwatch their children to ensure they are safe.
meanings.sent3: The owl decided to outwatch the mice in the barn.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse outwatches the ships as they pass by.
meanings.sent5: Outwatching the garden helps protect it from pests.
